titleStmt.title: (A key to the colourization may be found at: http://oracc.museum.upenn.edu/doc/user/teicolours.html.)X103010 = AD -302/301

s.note: ca. 4 lines broken away to edge

w.lemma: emēdu[lean on//be at a stationary point]V
emēdu[lean on//be at a stationary point]V
qablītu[middle watch (of the night)//middle watch (of the night)]N

That month, from the 20+[xth ...]

Night of the 8th, beginning of the night, the moon was [...] above [α Scorpii ...]
Night of the 18th, last part of the night, the moon was 2 2/3 cubits below η Piscium [...]
Night of the 22nd, last part of the night, the moon was
8 fingers below β/ζ Tauri, the moon being 2 fingers to [...]
Month VI, the 1st (of which followed the 30th of the preceding month), sunset to moonset: 11°; measured; (the moon) was faint. Night of the 3rd, the moon was [...] in fro[nt of α Librae.]
Night of the 11th, beginning of the night, the moon was [...] below γ Capricorni.
Night of the 15th, lunar eclipse of 1 finger; when I watched I did not see it.
Night of the 19th, last part of the night, the moon was 1 1/2 cubits in front of β Tauri.
The 29th, solar eclipse which was omitted; around 1.18° after sunset [...]

Month VII, the 1st (of which followed the 30th of the preceding month), sunset to moonset: [...]. Night of the 7th, beginning of the night, the moon was 5 cubits below β Capricorni. The 4th, Jupiter’s acronychal rising.
Night of the 16th, last part of the night, the moon was
[x]+1 1/2 cubit above η Tauri, the moon having passed 2/3 cubit to the east. [...]
Night of the 25th, last part of the night, the m[oon] was [...] behind γ Virginis.
[... β/δ] Scorpii.

[Month VIII, the 1st (of which followed the 30th of the preceding month)], sunset to moonset: 11° 20'; (the moon) was faint. Night of the 11th, first part of the night, Jupiter was 4 [...] β Arietis [...]
[Night] of the 4th, beginning of the night, the moon was 1 2/3 cubits in front of β Capricorni. Night of the 16th, beginning of the night,
Night of the 26th, last part of the night, the moon was 1/2 cubit below δ Scorpii [...]
113 talents of silver, 2 talents of gold of Nabû which in front ... [...]
they brought [from?] the craftsmens’ house and the streets of Borsippa ... [...]
Month IX, the 1st (of which followed the 30th of the preceding month), sunset to moonset: 17° 40'; it could be seen while the sun stood there; measured.
Night of the 8th, beginning of the night, the moon was 1/2 cubit in front of
η Piscium. Around the 26th, when Jupiter became stationary in the west, it became stationary 1 cubit in front of β Arietis.
Month X, the 1st (of which followed the 30th of the preceding month), sunset to moonset: 27°; measured; it could be seen while the sun stood there; earthshine. Night of the 10+[xth, ...]
Night of the 16th, last part of the night, the moon was 2 cubits in front of γ Virginis [...]

Night of the 16th, last part of the night, the moon was [...] behind α Virginis [...]
Night of the 24th, last part of the night, the moon was [...] below [β Capricorni ...]
That month, gold ... [...]
Month XII, (the 1st of which was identical with) the 30th (of the preceding month), sunset to moonset: 15° 30'; [...]
Night of the 14th, lunar eclipse ... [...]
[Month XII₂, the 1st (of which followed the 30th of the preceding month), sunset to moonset:] 23°; [...]

Night of the 13th, middle part of the night, the moon was 1 cu[bit] in front of β/δ Scorpii [...]
Month II, (the 1st of which was identical with) the 30th (of the preceding month), sunset to moonset: 18° 30'. Night of the 4th, beginning of the night, the moon was [... behind ε Leonis.]
Night of the 12th, beginning of the night, the moon was 1/2 cubit in front of α Scorpii. Night [of the 18th, last part of the night,]
the moon was 1 cubit below δ Capricorni, the moon being 8 fingers to [...]
Month III, (the 1st of which was identical with) the 30th (of the preceding month), sunset to moonset: 12° 40'; measured (despite) mist. [...]
